description: Donald Yates You have to search and scroll but in Suppl data 1, the haplotype shared by this "matriarchal ruling dynasty" is B2. That is in keeping with Puebloan peoples, Hopi, Polynesians, Choctaw, Cherokee and Chickasaw, all of whom are outside the "only A,B,C, D-single entry across landbridge" paradigm. Also noted is the telltale 9 basepair deletion NOT found in Siberians, which according to geneticists like Torroni, "could represent a migratory event distinct from the ones which brought group A, C, and D mtDNAs to the Americas." Jett, Ancient Ocean Crossings, ch. 31"Incongruous Genes in the Americas" (2017, U. of Alabama Press) seems to envisage three major migrations of B-- "6,300 years ago by boat-borne migrants of family groups from the southeast of what is now China, reinforced around 3,350 years ago by people from East China and, during the final three BC millennia by Malayo-Polynesians from the region of Indonesia's Celebes Sea." (p. 348) In Hopi tradition, it seems a certain type of B is carried by the Bamboo Clan (named for emergence on reeds of ships), another by the Sun Clan (associated with Egypt). The Bear Clan, although it would seem to be more native and indigenous and already encountered by the others, is also strongly B according to the very limited test results publicly available.   According to tradition the Bear and Sun clans alternate holding the chief (mongwi) positiion.

description: Donald Yates Here's the obituary in the Pensacola News Journal for Jo Ree White (married Louis Fantauzzi). Her mother and father died about 10 years ago. Don't know about her little boy Terry who must now be about 40. They lived in California. Jo Ree first went to New York with a girlfriend, where they crashed the jet set party scene and she worked as a secretary. I believe she was first married to Gregory Bannon and lived in Brooklyn Heights. We exchanged letters when I studied in Europe, and I remember she reported, "So you see, Donnie, while you've gone around the world I've gone up the ladder!" She had many brotheers and sisters, including Del, I was friends with. They all had tremendous, spell binding names. Her father drove a bread truck. The whole family was very, very Cherokee looking. I have other clippings. I also have a scrapbook she made for my mother. Wacky and interesting.

Donald Yates Sitting in the front porch swing, and listening to the cicadas and tree frogs, Teresa and I played a game we want to share with all people, students and teachers upon whom great art has been inflicted. It is our Top Ten list, with succinct one-sentence summaries, for future generations. No one has to read or see any of these stupid staples of our education again.  1. The Heart of Darkness. Morose homosexual European man travels to the Congo and broods.  2. Lawrence of Arabia. British brat escapes to Arabia and falls in love with Arab lads.  3. Moby Dick. Old white man chases old white whale and meets God.  4. The Last of the Mohicans. Noble savage rescues well-dressed damsels in distress and expires.  5. Old Testament. Yahweh creates the universe, world, people and all creatures and the people rebel and recant.  6. Long Day’s Journey into Night. Fashionable rant about being Irish.  7. New Testament. Long ago, men seek a messiah and when they find him, kill him, but he says he is coming back.  8. Benjamin Button. A young man grows so old he falls backward in time and disappears before the very eyes of astonished neighbors.  9. Remembrance of Times Past. Bed-ridden Parisian remembers precisely how a beloved cookie tasted in his childhood, and other things.  10. One Hundred Years of Solitude. Males of an obscure family fall generationally into soporic madness and splendid decrepitude, until the last scion is carried off by ants.

description: Donald Yates https://youtu.be/uuZoeRsoWO0  Six years ago we returned from a long trip to Rome and other points and I made this video. Sound track is by Beethoven and Verdi. Boy, I couldn't walk all over the place as we did then! I also kept a journal I published as On the Trail of Europa. One marvelous event that happened to me was on the Appian Way, I looked down and there was an eagle feather. It had been run over several times by the mad traffic. I picked it up and later verified it. It was a wing feather of a golden eagle.

comments.content: How was he related to the Tihahnama ?

He followed Chief Gray Dog as chief of the Tihanama in Florida and then moved a bunch of them to Middle Tennessee about 1992. He said his heritage was Shawnee, Cherokee (grandfather Pipes) and Potawhatomi, with a minor amount of Tihanama. He said his ggg-grandmother who loved Sam Houston but did not marry him had a Tihanama mother. I forget her name.

Here's a little known chapter from American history. Sam Houston’s Broken Heart  The family connection:  my 7g-grandfather Henry Labon Cooper married Molly Houston.  His father was William Cooper, the part-Indian guide for Daniel Boone. William Cooper  ... See More
Picture shows Ruck Sizemore, said to be the last medicine man of the Cherokee Indians not removed (Chickamauga Cherokee).
TY  Donald Yates  for I too am Tihahnama. We are 4th cousins to each other. I'm descended from William Wiley Redwine also.
All best.
My mother's father Granddaddy Cooper used to have a painting or old tintype of Sarah Redwine. It was said she was very beautiful.

Wiley's daughter Sarah married James Bundren (Bondurant) as I recall. Their daughter Nancy was my Granddaddy Cooper's mother, hence my ggrandmother. Most of them are buried on the top of Sand Mountain under huge stone memorials. The Bondurants came fro ... See More

description: Donald Yates Have just published the fourth edition of the ancient Cherokee national epic, as recounted by George (Soggy) Sanders and William Eubanks in the 1890s. This was a text I rescued and edited first in 2011 under its original newspaper title Red Man's Origin. Now it is The Cherokee Origin Narrative. The illustrations were spruced up a bit. In the meantime I have paid to have it translated and published in Spanish, Italian and German. The German translation has a new preface by ethnologist Christine Pellech. The Spanish and Italian are also available on audiobooks. I felt so strongly that Cherokee people should have access to their tribal origin narrative and libraries in Europe should have copies that I have published all these versions. There is no other version or equivalent. No other tribe has such a treasure. Next is perhaps French.

description: Donald Yates These books in German by Viennese ethnolog Christine Pellech have not been translated into English and are not available through Amazon in this country, only in Germany. Donald Yates It was nice to see all my classmates at the reunion. Many were interested in my DNA testing company. If you're interested in taking one of our DNA tests I've created a 20% discount, code: choctawindians. Don't want to burden the site and hope this post is not off topic. Go to the website at  http://dnaconsultants.com  or call us at 1-888-806-2588 M-F between 10 and 6 Mountain Time. I'm at ext. 3 but anyone will be able to help you. Apologize if I have offended anyone.

Be sure to compare to original Medicare and medigap policy. Check to make sure that your physicians accept a Medicare Advantage plan.
I've been with a Humana plan in my area for four years.

description: Donald Yates This may be a little off topic and I apologize if so. Many of you are probably on Medicare and have been so for 2-3 years. I've been on it for over 2 years and Teresa is just getting on it. In contacting the Medicare rep (don't ask how), she learned of an option called Medicare Advantage that does not cost any more than basic Medicare but includes many extras, notably 0 copay for doctor's visits, replaces Part D drug coverage with mostly 0 copy for prescriptions, etc. She got it and I switched to it, beginning Jan. 1. It will save me hundreds or even thousands next year over basic Medicare. I wanted to tell my Choctaw classmates about it. The plan number we got is Humana H2649-043. Enrollment (annual) is open until Dec. 7 with coverage starting Jan. 1. Once you enroll your Part D drug coverage is automatically kicked out by Medicare, which substitutes drug coverage under Medicare Advantage. You do get a new card which you show to doctors, drugstores, etc. My rep took an hour or more enrolling me and she was super! Her name is Rhonda and I asked if I could pass her number on to my classmates, and she said she is licensed to operate in 30 states, including Florida. Her number is 1-888-376-0947. Her company is True Bridge. She may recommend a different carrier than Humana for you, depending on your answers to the health questionnaire and what state you are in. We were extremely skeptical at first but glad we found out (through Facebook), and I wanted to pass along the info. Sorry if I have offended anyone but this is the real deal and I know we are probably all on Medicare with few exceptions. If you have any questions you can message, call or email me. I'm putting the same message on my personal FB page.

comments.content: Your memories of your earlier grade school years took me far back too, Don. Fortunately, I loved all my elementary teachers and loved learning so do not remember being bored. I enjoyed your recollections.

description: Donald Yates  uploaded a file in the group:  Choctaw 1967 Reunion . Beth's "fun picture" reminded me of a chapter in a never-shared book I wrote many years ago (ten). Even though I was in a grade below all the rest of y'all until seventh grade and going to Prior, I think you'll all get a kick out of this walk down memory lane. I could never remember all the details today in my foggy minded condition so am glad I put the memories down on paper when I did. This is the chapter titled "School." Enjoy!
